Job Title: Supply Chain Analyst

Location: Winslow, ME

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
At Elanco (NYSE: ELAN) – it all starts with animals!

As a global leader in animal health, we are dedicated to innovation and delivering products and services to prevent and treat disease in farm animals and pets. We’re driven by our vision of ‘Food and Companionship Enriching Life’ and our approach to sustainability – the Elanco Healthy Purpose™ – to advance the health of animals, people, the planet and our enterprise.

At Elanco, we pride ourselves on fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We believe that diversity is the driving force behind innovation, creativity, and overall business success. Here, you’ll be part of a company that values and champions new ways of thinking, work with dynamic individuals, and acquire new skills and experiences that will propel your career to new heights.

Making animals’ lives better makes life better – join our team today!

The Supply Chain Analyst is accountable for generating and maintaining an optimum production, testing, and packaging schedule. The Analyst will leverage SAP while balancing supply chain forecast and demand as well as production capacity requirements, managing material availability, and resolving operational constraints at Winslow Manufacturing. This role interfaces with both internal and external teams to achieve key site objectives while advocating for our customers.

Functions, Duties, Tasks, Responsibilities:

On-time release of process orders, manufacturing, or label/pack.Maintenance of accurate dispatch lists in SAP.Consistent communication with process team members regarding operation status and work center capacities.Ownership of the SMOI process by forecasting and managing material expirations to mitigate production schedule disruptions and minimize destructions due to obsolescence.Management and ownership of inventory and SAP master data points related to planning.Actively facilitate interactions and communication between the supply chain organization and shop floor colleagues.Proactively highlight issues that could impact the schedule and lead efforts to eliminate or minimize delays.Prepare and present supply plan and forecast as it pertains to S&OP/R&OP, Business Planning, and Strategy Planning.Anticipate and drive resolution of capacity constraints. Ensure any major capacity issues are escalated appropriately.On-time release of purchase orders in SAP and Ariba as applicableTrouble shooting and support for customers and vendors on procurement processes, including but not limited to, ordering and invoicing as applicable.Anticipates and responds to internal and external customer needs.Ownership for CORRS performance.Play an active role in Global Supply Chain initiatives.Regularly review inventory and safety stock levels.Actively participates and/or may lead projects and process improvements.Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or three years’ experience of SAP planning and/or procurement will be considered in lieu of a degree. Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and written. Consistent execution of timely deliverables. Experience with SAP or equivalent ERP system. Completion of Post Offer Exam, Completion of Work Simulation or Completion of Administrative Skills Testing if applicable.

Additional Preferences:

Animal Health/Pharmaceutical industry experience and familiarity with USDA and other regulatory requirements.Demonstrated proficiency in a data driven approach to problem solving.Drive results and work with autonomy.Problem solving through mastery of supply chain best practices.Demonstrated ability to lead through influence.Demonstrated ability to negotiate effectively.

Other Information:

Location: Winslow, ME (Onsite)Travel: Minimal, less than 5%PPE required in specific areas of the manufacturing plant.

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
